title: SCVNews . com | SCV Chamber Hosts 15th Annual Salute to Patriots , Honorees Announced
body_text: [Sign Up Now] to Receive Our FREE Daily SCVTV-SCVNews Digest by E-Mail Inside Weather Calendar Today in S.C.V. History S.C.V. History February 13 Join the Santa Clarita Valley Chamber of Commerce on Wednesday, Nov. 5 at the SCV Senior Center as the 15th Annual Salute to Patriots honors the brave men and women who have served the nation and continue to make a difference in the SCV community. Registration begins at 3:30 p.m. and the program starts at 4 p.m. at SCV Senior Center, 27180 Golden Valley Road, Santa Clarita, CA 91351. The 15th Annual Salute to Patriots, presented in partnership with the City of Santa Clarita, celebrates local veterans who have demonstrated extraordinary dedication to our country and our business community. The 2025 honorees are: Camille Applin-Jones Juan Blanco Robert Lasher Vernon Charles Miller Anthony Straight Deputy Keith Wells Eric White Gather with fellow community members, business leaders and local veterans in celebration of their service, hear their inspiring stories and show gratitude for their remarkable contributions, both in uniform and in the professional world. This important afternoon honors the courage, leadership and legacy of local heroes, join in paying tribute to these outstanding veterans. Tickets are $50 for SCV Chamber members, $60 for nonmembers. For information and tickets visit www.scvchamber.com/events/15th-annual-salute-to-patriots. Comment On This Story COMMENT POLICY: We welcome comments from individuals and businesses. All comments are moderated. Comments are subject to rejection if they are vulgar, combative, or in poor taste. REAL NAMES ONLY: All posters must use their real individual or business name. Declares Cash Dividend MARKETS & METALS CURRENCY CONVERTER Latest Additions to SCVNews.com State Senator Suzette Martinez Valladares has announced the introduction of SB 1060, legislation establishing a statewide standard requiring large residential alcohol and drug rehabilitation facilities to be located at least 1,000 feet away from public or private elementary schools, secondary schools and daycare centers. Overtime and penalty kicks were not good to our Foothill League boys soccer squads in the playoffs on Feb. 11. And the result was that only one of five teams, yes, the one that did not have to go to overtime, collected a victory. None of the Foothill League girls teams had to go to overtime, and two out of four came away with victories on Feb. 12. 1999 - SCV & AV split off from 805 area code to become 661 [story]
